name: MEDPlat
description: MEDPlat is an mobile first, offline enabled, scalable, low-code CPHC platform for public healthcare. It is extensible & customizable and has tools to supports the monitoring and improvement of SDG3 goals though interfaces right for the community health workers onwards to the policy makers. It Includes preconfigured workflows that can be further customized for Reproductive, Maternal, Child health, Adolescent, Nutrition and many more health verticals.

sdgs.relevance:
MEDPlat has pre-configured workflows in the Reprductive, Materal, Child, Adolescent health programs. It supports the health workers right from the community level to the entire primary health care continum and beyond to register, screen, monitor the key indicators on a continuous basis, ensure timely serives such as ANC, PNC, Routine Immunization and such others based on clinical protocols, Automatically triage and identify high risk from the service data entered and provide worksflows for enhanced monitoring and mitagation of high risks to prevent needless deaths and reduce Maternal dealths (MMR), IMR (under 5), and Neonatal dealths. 
The Platform has an extensive Child Health Monitoring module at population level and for school going children and includes routine immunization workflows and addresses 3.b.1 
The Platform also has tools to tools to monitor and address unmet family planning needs in eligible couples (SDG 3.7.1). Being a population based program, the platform enables and amplifies the access to health facilities thereby addressing SDG 3.8.1

openStandards:
The MEDPlat system adheres to the following open standards
HL7 FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources): The platform utilizes HL7 FHIR to enable seamless sharing and exchange of health data between different healthcare systems and applications. The platform is complient to the Government of India - National Health Authority ABHA program (Milestone M1

M3) which requires FHIR r4 as mandatory and hence complience demonstrated. 
SNOMED CT (Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms): We incorporate SNOMED CT for standardized clinical terminology

enhancing accurate communication and data exchange among healthcare professionals.
OAuth 2.0 - We have implemented OAuth 2.0 for secure and standardized authentication and authorization of users and applications.
The Platform follows all best practices in transmision and persistance of data

Utilization of Private and Public keys including the following. 
All data exchanges are secure using SSL / HTTPS. We use AES standards for encryption.
UTF-8 standards is consistency adhered to in the platform for all encoding. 
Adherence to relevant and key open standards ensure that MEDPlat is interoperable and enables seemless data exchange and also aligns with the principles of the Digital Public Goods Alliance.
bestPractices:
The Platform has been designed based on key principles and practices including the following. 

Privacy by Design and Data Security - Taking full congnizance that the platform collects and uses health information
we follow the Principle of Privacy by Design. All aspects of the system is designed to ensure data privacy and security with apprpriate 'need to know' access

multiple points where MFA is enabled and other aspects to generate confidence in the user and more importantly ensure that there is reasonable care taken to ensure security and privacy of the data at every stage. 

User-Centered Design: Our entire design process invovles the user. The usability and experience of the user is paramount and hence we always follow user-centered design practices to create an intuitive and accessible experience for all stakeholders.

Interoperability and Standards: The platform adheres t open standards wherever applicable and appropriate to ensure seamless integration and data exchange between different healthcare systems.
Scalability and Performance: The application has already been proven at scale in multiple instances. Best practices for scalability and performance optimization is a continuous activity starting from the design stage thus ensuring our platform is capable of handling increased user loads and deliver a responsive experience at all times. 
Continuous Monitoring and Improvement:Our platform undergoes continuous monitoring

and iterative improvements to address emerging challenges and maintain high standards.
We continuoulsy look to adopt and adhere to best practices and principles
so that MEDPlat provides a secure

and ethically responsible solution that aligns with the values of the Digital Public Goods Alliance at all times. 

In addition to the pratices mentioned above
we follow an Agile method of software development and maintenance and create user stories based on the users perceived

felt and notional needs. A strong change management using version control ensures business continuity while upgrading the systems and combined with a continuous Integration & Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)

faults are identified early in the deployment lifecycle reducing risks.
Code review and Code refactoring are scheduled at regular intervals to ensure that the code is always at its best avatar. 
At the architecture level

we use a Model–view–controller paradigm at the core and use REST API extensively. 
Being a low-code application
we have implemented a unique and effective Event-driven protocol and the entire application is database-centric

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is collected and stored but NOT distributed.
typesOfPIIDataCollected:
We collect the following Personally Identifyable data
1. Name 
2. Age / Date of Birth
3. Mobile Phone Number
4. Address / Locality of place of stay. 
5. Aaadhar Number (Govt Issued proof of identity)
dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity: The data collected is stored in secure data centers with very highly restricted access. The key data such as Aadhar Number is encrupted and stored in an Aadhar Vault as required and mandated by the Govt of India - UIDAI. (Unique Identification Authority of India).
